The deceased was apparently under the influence of alcohol and fell asleep under the tempo while taking shelter from the rain when the incident occurred. A case has been registered in the matter.

349.title: Hoarding with KCR's questions to PM Modi put up in Hyderabad
349.article_body: A hoarding showing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's questions to PM Narendra Modi was put up at Diamond Point Road near Parade Ground in Hyderabad. With a hashtag #ModiMustAnswer, KCR was shown questioning the PM on death of farmers during farm law protests and that of migrants during lockdown, promise to bring black money and privatisation of PSUs.

350.title: 19-year-old shooter Ankit arrested for Sidhu Moosewala's murder in Delhi
350.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 19-year-old shooter Ankit along with his associate in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Officers said Ankit is one of the shooters involved in Moosewala's murder and the other accused, Sachin, was responsible for harbouring four of the shooters after the killing. Police recovered two pistols, 19 live cartridges and three uniforms of Punjab Police from them.

351.title: He got a good delivery, that's how I'd describe it: Zaheer on Kohli's wicket
351.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal during India's second innings in the ongoing Test against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said the ex-India captain "couldn't do much" on the delivery. "Kohli got a good delivery. That's how I would describe his dismissal...If a bowler gets you out with a good ball, what kind of analysis can you do?" stated Zaheer.

352.title: SC to hear Uddhav faction's plea against Speaker's decision on party whip
352.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea by former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction against the Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar's decision to recognise Shiv Sena's new whip. The matter will be heard on July 11, after the court's summer break. "The Speaker has no jurisdiction to recognise whips," said senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi, representing the Thackeray group.

353.title: Ajay Devgn to direct Hindi remake of Tamil movie 'Kaithi'
353.article_body: Actor-director Ajay Devgn is all set to direct 'Bholaa' starring Tabu and himself in the lead roles. The upcoming film is the Hindi remake of 'Kaithi', a Tamil action-thriller which featured Karthi, Arjun Das and Narain among others in pivotal roles. Ajay has previously directed films like 'U Me Aur Hum', 'Shivaay' and 'Runway 34'.

354.title: Ronaldo has ego; wants to leave Man Utd because of Messi reason: Ex-player
354.article_body: Former Irish footballer Tony Cascarino has said that Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English club because of the fear of Paris Saint-Germain's Lionel Messi overtaking him as UEFA Champions League's top goalscorer. "Ronaldo...has an ego... I'm a bit suspicious because he's got 141 goals in the Champions League. Messi has got 125," Cascarino said.

355.title: Court issues bailable warrant against Raut in ₹100 crore defamation case
355.article_body: A court in Mumbai on Monday issued a bailable warrant against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in a defamation case of ₹100 crore filed by BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife. The warrant was issued after Raut failed to appear before court. Earlier, Raut had claimed that Somaiya and his wife were involved in a public toilets scam worth ₹100 crore.

356.title: Farmers' body says govt didn't fulfil promises, warns of protests
356.article_body: Farmers' body Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Sunday accused the Centre of not delivering on the promises made to them in exchange of withdrawing protests last year. It said that the government neither formed a committee on MSP nor withdrew cases against farmers. It said it will start an agitation, "Protest Against Betrayal", during the monsoon session of Parliament.

357.title: China asks Canada to 'stop meddling' in Hong Kong affairs
357.article_body: China has asked Canada to "stop meddling" in Hong Kong affairs. This comes after Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said that Hong Kong's freedom was being suppressed under Chinese authority. "Hong Kong affairs are purely China's internal affairs, and no external forces are in the position to make irresponsible remarks," said the Chinese embassy in Ottawa.

358.title: We should be prepared for people speaking against us: Fadnavis
358.article_body: Soon after the Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in Maharashtra Assembly, the state's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that everyone should be prepared to listen to adversary's voices in politics. "We've seen that people were jailed for making statements...We should be prepared for people speaking against us. We should respond to criticism but in a proper way," he said.

359.title: JD(U), BJP in search of their own Eknath Shinde: Chirag Paswan
359.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party’s (LJP) Chirag Paswan said that the JD(U) and its ally BJP were in search of "their own Eknath Shinde", in Bihar. Furthermore, Paswan said that the two parties are in alliance “just for the sake of power”. "Both are trying to pull the ally down," he added while addressing a press conference.

360.title: Twinkle attends Adele concert, pride walk with Akshay in London, shares video
360.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar attended Adele's concert and a pride walk in London recently. She took to Instagram on Sunday to share a video capturing "one of the best days of [her] life". "The best thing about...best day is it happens unexpectedly...Happiness is accidental...It only collides against you when you are looking the other way," she wrote.

361.title: Seniors forced me to massage their bodies, harassed me: Sprinter Dutee Chand
361.article_body: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand revealed that her seniors used to force her to massage their bodies when she was at the sports hostel in Bhubaneswar. She added they also used to force her to wash their clothes. "When I opposed them...they used to harass me," she stated. "It used to take a mental toll on me," Dutee said.

362.title: Getting threat calls asking to not take Kerala CM's name: Swapna Suresh
362.article_body: Swapna Suresh, who is the prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, said that she is getting threat calls. "They are demanding not to take the names of Kerala CM, his wife, daughter and MLA KT Jaleel. Someone with the name of Maradu Aneesh is doing this...They are threatening to kill me," she added.

363.title: India to drop windfall tax if oil prices fall $40 a barrel: Revenue Secretary
363.article_body: India will withdraw its windfall tax for oil producers and refiners only if global prices of crude oil fall to $40 a barrel from present levels, said Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj. Last week, the Centre imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne additional tax on domestically produced crude oil to take away windfall gains accruing to producers from high international oil prices.

364.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi condoles loss of lives in Himachal bus accident
364.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled loss of lives in a bus accident in Himachal's Kullu and called the incident "heart-rending". "In this tragic hour my thoughts are with the bereaved families. I hope those injured recover at the earliest," PM said. He also announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the next of kin of those who died in the accident.

365.title: Ex-MLA pays ₹20 lakh to hitmen to kill daughter in Bihar; arrested
365.article_body: A former MLA Surendra Sharma was apprehended on Sunday for allegedly ordering his daughter's "honour killing" after she married a man from another caste in Bihar's Patna, police said. The hitmen, whom Sharma paid ₹20 lakh, revealed the information, the city's SP (East) Pramod Kumar said. An attempt to kill the woman was made earlier this month, he added.

366.title: Gill, Vihari missed opportunity to cement their places: Jaffer on Eng Test
366.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Shubman Gill and Hanuma Vihari missed their opportunities to cement their place in India after failing to convert their knocks into big scores in the ongoing England Test. "Players like Sarfaraz Khan are knocking on the door and even Suryakumar Yadav is available. So yes to some extent [they have missed a chance]," stated Jaffer.

367.title: Neither yours nor for your son, it’s BJP’s turn: Shah to KCR on T'gana CM post
367.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Sunday said as the country moves forward, Telangana is lagging behind. "KCR (Telangana CM) doesn't care about your source of livelihood…He just wants to make his son CM. KCR, the next turn is neither yours nor for your son. The next turn is meant for the BJP," Shah said in Hyderabad.

368.title: Federer receives standing ovation as he enters Wimbledon's Centre Court, video viral
368.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Roger Federer receiving a standing ovation as he entered the Wimbledon's Centre Court for a ceremony on Sunday. The ceremony marked the centenary of Centre Court. "Of course, I’ve missed being here. I would have loved to be here," said Federer, who is not taking part in the ongoing Wimbledon.

369.title: Delhi man hits 3 members of a family, strikes their dog's head with iron rod over barking
369.article_body: A man attacked three members of a family in Delhi and struck their dog on its head with an iron pipe after it barked at him. He also picked up the dog by its tail and threw it away. The dog's owner intervened, leading to a scuffle with the man, who was bitten by the dog in the meantime.

370.title: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde wins trust vote
370.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly on Monday as it surpassed the majority mark of 144. It comes a day after BJP's Rahul Narwekar was elected the Assembly Speaker. Earlier in the day, Narwekar reinstated CM Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader.

371.title: Tiger Shroff to team up with Shashank Khaitan for an action film: Reports
371.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff and filmmaker Shashank Khaitan are reportedly teaming up for an action film. Production is expected to begin in August in Portugal. According to reports, the yet-untitled film will be shot at Belém Tower, Aveiro, Serra da Estrela (Portugal's highest mountain range) and the Palácio Nacional da Pena among many others. Tiger is currently working on 'Ganapath'.

372.title: Chanderpaul, who scored over 10,000 Test runs, appointed coach of US women teams
372.article_body: Ex-West Indies batter Shivnarine Chanderpaul has been appointed head coach of the US senior women's and the Under-19 teams for 18 months. "I've enjoyed being involved in American cricket over the years as a resident of Orlando, so to be given this opportunity...is incredible," stated Chanderpaul, who's one of the 14 cricketers to score more than 10,000 Test runs.

373.title: Tesla free to come but its special treatment not in India's interest: Ola CEO
373.article_body:
Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has said, "Tesla is free to come in and put up a shop here...They just want to be treated differently from others, which I believe isn't in the interests of India." Earlier, Tesla CEO Elon Musk had said the company won't build its manufacturing
plant in any location where it can't sell its cars first.

374.title: 12-year-old cancer patient made Prayagraj Police ADG for a day
374.article_body: A 12-year-old cancer patient was made the Additional Director General (ADG) of Prayagraj Police for a day. ADG (Prayagraj zone), Prem Prakash, also gifted a body kit to the boy. Reports said that the boy asked questions about the police functioning and also browsed the documents while sitting on chair of ADG. He reportedly also signed and forwarded some reports.

375.title: 77 including 23 kids kept in church's basement, freed in Nigeria
375.article_body: Police have freed 77 people, including 23 children, kept in a church's basement in Nigeria's Ondo by pastors preaching to them about Christian believers ascending to heaven with Jesus Christ's second coming, authorities said. The incident came to light after a woman raised an alarm over a possible kidnapping, locals said. Two pastors are in custody, a police spokesperson said.

376.title: 31 bodies, some decomposing, found at funeral home in US
376.article_body: As many as 31 bodies were found at a funeral home in US' Indiana, following which the police launched an investigation. Some bodies were said to be in the advanced stages of decomposition. The cremated remains of 16 people were also found at the Lankford Funeral Home and Family Center. The remains were taken to the coroner's office for identification.

377.title: Congress in Gujarat exists only on paper: Arvind Kejriwal
377.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Congress party in Gujarat largely exists only on paper. "The office-bearers of AAP have to ensure that not a single vote is cast for Congress in Assembly elections," Kejriwal added. "We'll have our booth level organisation in place next month. By then, we'll have built an organisation bigger than BJP in Gujarat," he stated.

378.title: Pant did no wonders, it was England bowlers' fault: Mohammad Asif
378.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Asif has said India's Rishabh Pant's 146(111) during their first innings in the ongoing Test against England was "England bowlers' fault". He added, "Pant did no wonders...he managed to score a century because English bowlers didn't bowl to him in his weak areas." With his hundred, Pant has become the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

379.title: Opposing car shed at Aarey is like opposing environment: Fadnavis
379.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has said that opposing the metro car shed project in Aarey colony is like opposing the environment. "This is a metro line that is in the interests of Mumbaikars...it will end the congestion and pollution in Mumbai," Fadnavis said. "Hence, we will evolve a consensus and complete this work," Fadnavis added.

380.title: India's Tejas is Malaysia's 'top choice' for MiG-29 replacement: HAL chief
380.article_body: India's light combat aircraft Tejas has emerged as Malaysia's "top choice" for replacing its fleet of Russian MiG-29 fighter planes, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) chairman R Madhavan said. "I am very confident about the deal, unless some political shift takes place," Madhavan added. If the deal is sealed, it will give a "very good signal" to other buyers, he said.

381.title: Spartan Poker's 'Spartanverse' aims to lead metaverse gaming revolution
381.article_body: Online poker platform Spartan Poker announced its entry into the metaverse with the launch of 'Spartanverse'. Honouring legends of the Indian poker fraternity, it has a virtual Hall-of-Fame, hosting all the winners of India Online Poker Championship (IOPC), it revealed. "(It's the) first step towards building an immersive, virtual and futuristic poker experience," Founder & CEO Amin Rozani added.

382.title: Kishore said Madhubala had hole in heart, will live for 2 yrs: Actress' sister
382.article_body: Late actress Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said that late singer Kishore Kumar had broken the news of Madhubala having a hole in her heart to her family and had said she will live only for two years. She added that Kumar had told them there is no cure for her condition and that their mother had fainted upon hearing news.

383.title: Prabhas is super friendly, he feeds people with so much love: Co-star Shruti
383.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan opened up about her experience of working with Prabhas in the upcoming film 'Salaar'. Calling him "super chilled out" and "super friendly", Shruti said it was really nice to work with him. She further said Prabhas feeds people with "so much love", adding that it's one of his best qualities. 'Salaar' is expected to release in 2023.

384.title: Video captures moment glacier collapses in Italian Alps; 6 killed, 8 injured
384.article_body: Parts of a mountain glacier collapsed in the Italian Alps on Sunday amid record temperatures, local authorities said, killing at least six people and injuring eight. A video has captured the moment an ice mass collapsed down the slopes of Marmolada, which at more than 3,300 metres is the highest mountain in the Dolomites.

385.title: It was reckless batting: Pietersen on Stokes' wicket in 5th Test vs India
385.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has criticised England captain Ben Stokes for his batting during their first innings in the ongoing Test against India. "I was watching Stokes run down the wicket and slog the ball straight into the air. It was reckless batting...He's too good a player [for] this," stated Pietersen. Stokes was dropped twice before being dismissed on 25(36).

386.title: People say Kishore converted to Islam to marry, that's not true: Madhubala's sister
386.article_body: Talking about late singer Kishore Kumar's marriage with Madhubala, the late actress' youngest sister said, "A lot of people say that Kishore had converted to Islam to marry Madhu apa, but that’s not true." She added, "He was a Hindu and he passed away a Hindu. None of the husbands who married into our family changed their religion."

387.title: Maha Speaker reinstates Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader
387.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker, Rahul Narwekar, has reinstated state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislative party leader. The Speaker has also reinstated Bharat Gogawale as the party's Chief Whip. News Agency ANI reported that appointment of Ajay Chaudhary as legislative party leader has been set aside by the Speaker.

388.title: Goenka shares pic with 'lookalike' Maharashtra CM, says 'My security can be a nuisance'
388.article_body: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka on Sunday tweeted a photo of himself with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while referring to the similarities in their appearance. Goenka tweeted, "To those who come to meet me, sorry for any [inconvenience]. I know my Z+ security can be a nuisance. Look forward to your support. Jai Maharashtra!"

389.title: Overcast conditions, light showers likely in Delhi today: IMD
389.article_body: Overcast conditions are likely to prevail in Delhi on Monday, with the city likely to get 'light to moderate' thundershowers in the evening. According to the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the capital will be around 27 degrees Celsius, while the maximum temperature will be 36 degrees Celsius.

390.title: Will give all donations to charity: Amazon delivery boy who saved Thane girl
390.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent, who helped in saving a child after part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane, said that he would give all the money he received as donations to charity. "My phone has been ringing constantly...with people from several states in India calling me," the agent said.

391.title: 16, including school children, dead after private bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Kullu
391.article_body: At least 16 people, including some school children, died after a private bus fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The bus was travelling from Shansher to Sainj when the incident happened. The driver reportedly lost control and the bus fell 200 metres into the gorge. The bus is said to be carrying more than 40 passengers.

392.title: 50-yr-old labourer falls off 6th floor in Delhi, contractor booked
392.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer was severely injured after falling off the sixth floor of a building undergoing repair in Delhi's Dwarka. The police booked the contractor after the victim complained that he did not provide proper equipment for work. The victim said that despite flagging the danger of using a loosely-tied bamboo seat for work, the contractor didn't make suitable arrangements.

393.title: India sees 16,135 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths; active cases reach 1,13,864
393.article_body: India has reported 16,135 COVID-19 cases, 13,958 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,103 cases and 31 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,13,864, while the death toll reached 5,25,223.

394.title: 25 dead, 53 injured in Mumbai last month due to monsoon mishaps: BMC data
394.article_body: Mumbai witnessed 25 deaths and 53 people were injured in more than 600 rain-related incidents in June, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. The highest number of victims (19 deaths) were reported in the Kurla building collapse incident. The civic body has identified 382 dilapidated buildings this monsoon season, of which people still reside in 199 such buildings.

395.title: Why don’t you rename Ahmedabad to Adanibad?: KTR on BJP’s demand to rename Hyd
395.article_body: After BJP leader and ex-Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad’s name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana, TRS leader KT Rama Rao asked, "Why don’t you change Ahmedabad’s name to Adanibad first?" Meanwhile, speaking about BJP’s national executive meet, BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar."

396.title: 4 killed, 7 injured in lightning strikes in UP's Sitapur
396.article_body: Four people were killed and seven others injured after being struck by lightning in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh’s Sitapur on Sunday. Two of the deceased were working in a field when they were struck by lightning. The SDM said that district administration will provide ₹4 lakh as financial compensation to the deceased’s families. The bodies were sent for post-mortem.

397.title: Iran cuts price of its crude oil in China amid competition with Russia: Report
397.article_body: Iran has discounted its crude oil price in China amid competition with Russia, as per a report. Russian exports to China surged to a record level in May, making it China's biggest supplier of oil and displacing Saudi Arabia from that position. Notably, China's official data only lists three months of imports from Iran since the end of 2020.

398.title: When I got a call for 'Ms Marvel', I had to pinch myself: Farhan
398.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar, who plays the role of Waleed in 'Ms Marvel', has said he's a huge fan of Marvel Cinematic Universe. "So when I got a call from my agent...that 'They're looking for someone out of India and are hoping you'll do this part,' I'd to pinch myself," he added. Farhan appeared in the fourth episode of the show.

399.title: We had to stay patient, wait for England batters to make mistakes: Siraj
399.article_body: After England were bundled out for 284 in their first innings in the ongoing rescheduled Test, India's Mohammed Siraj said they focused on the basics and waited for the England batters to make mistakes. He added that the plan was to hit one area consistently as the ball was "keeping low" on occasions. India ended Day 3 at 125/3.

400.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav falls from stairs at wife's home, fractures shoulder; hospitalised
400.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Prasad Yadav was admitted to Paras Hospital in Patna. He was hospitalised after he reportedly lost his balance and fell down the stairs at his wife Rabri Devi's residence yesterday. News agency ANI reported that Yadav has suffered a minor fracture in his right shoulder, following which, his health deteriorated.

401.title: Neesham trolls Kohli for sledging Bairstow, says 'Give him a gift basket each morning'
401.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham trolled Virat Kohli for sledging Jonny Bairstow on Day 3 of the rescheduled fifth Test. "Why do opposing teams keep making...Bairstow angry lol, he gets 10x better," Neesham wrote. He added, "Give him a gift basket each morning, let him know you're having his car valeted while he's batting. Anything to keep him happy."
